actions.text: Reported to House from the Committee on the Budget, H. Rept. 94-145.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #173 (200-196).
Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.
Measure passed Senate, amended, (Provisions of S.Con. Res. 218 inserted).
Conference report filed in Senate, S. Rept. 94-113.
Conference report filed in House, H. Rept. 94-198.
House agreed to conference report, roll call #205 (230-193).
House agreed to return measure to Senate.

official_title: Concurrent resolution setting forth, on an aggregate basis only, the congressional budget for the U.S. Government for the fiscal year 1976.

summary.text: (Conference report filed in House, H. Rept. 94-198) States the Congress' determination that for fiscal year 1976: (1) the appropriate level of total budget outlays is $367,000,000,000; (2) the appropriate level of total new budget authority is $395,800,000,000; (3) the amount of the deficit in the budget is $68,820,000,000,000; (4) the recommended level of Federal revenues is $298,180,000,000, and the amount by which the aggregate level of Federal revenues should be decreased is $3,400,000; and (5) the appropriate level of the public debt is $617,600,000,000 and the amount by which the temporary statutory limit on such debt should accordingly be increased is $86,600,000,000.

titles.title: Concurrent resolution setting forth, on an aggregate basis only, the congressional budget for the U.S. Government for the fiscal year 1976.
